models.classes

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.classes.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This manages the entirety of a Game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Creates a new Game with any properties.

    • Method Detail

      • getFreePlayerColors

        public java.util.List<PlayerColor> getFreePlayerColors()
        Returns all unused PlayerColors.
        Returns:
        List of unused PlayerColors.

      • createPlayerWithColor

        public void createPlayerWithColor(PlayerColor playerColor)
                           throws PlayerColorAlreadyUsed
        Creates a Player in the Game with the PlayerColor passed in parameter.
        Parameters:
        playerColor - PlayerColor of the Player to be created.
        Throws:
        PlayerColorAlreadyUsed

      • generateDominoes

        public void generateDominoes()
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             InvalidDominoesCSVFile
        Generates the Dominos for the current Game. This collects all Dominos stored in a csv file and select randomly the good number of them according to the number of Players and the GameMode.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        InvalidDominoesCSVFile
        See Also:
        CSVReader.getDominoes()

      • initiatePlayers

        public void initiatePlayers()
                     throws MaxCrownsLandPortionExceeded
        Initiates all Player attributes such as their Boards or Kings.
        Throws:
        MaxCrownsLandPortionExceeded - If a LandPortion has an invalid number of crowns.

      • getNewDominoesList

        public DominoesList getNewDominoesList()
        Get the new line of Dominos on the Game.
        Returns:
        DominoesList containing all Dominos in the new Game line.

      • getPreviousDominoesList

        public DominoesList getPreviousDominoesList()
        Get the previous line of Dominos on the Game.
        Returns:
        DominoesList containing all Dominos in the previous Game line.

      • pickDominoes

        public void pickDominoes()
                  throws NoMoreDominoInGameStack,
                         NotEnoughDominoesInGameStack
        Picks as number of Dominos in the Game stack as the number of Kings in the Game.
        Throws:
        NoMoreDominoInGameStack - There is no more Dominos in the Game stack. This is consequently the last turn.
        NotEnoughDominoesInGameStack - There is not enough Dominos in the Game stack. It's probably a bug as the number of Dominos in the Game stack is a multiple of the number of Players.

      • playerChoosesDomino

        public Response playerChoosesDomino(Domino domino)
        Sets the domino passed as parameter as a Domino of the current Player.
        Parameters:
        domino - Domino to be set as one of the current Player.
        Returns:
        Response.NEXTTURNPLAYER if it must be the turn of the next Player. Response.PICKDOMINOES if a new turn must be started. A new line of Dominos must be picked. Response.SHOWPLACEPOSSIBILITIES if the Position possibilities must be shown for the domino. Response.GAMEOVER if the Game is over. Response.NULL if nothing must be done. It's probably a bug.

      • numberKingsInGame

        public int numberKingsInGame()
        Returns the number of Kings in the Game.
        Returns:
        Number of Kings in the Game.

      • makeRotateDomino

        public void makeRotateDomino(Domino domino)
        Makes rotate a Domino by 90 degrees. It impacts the view of the Game and shows new Position possibilities according to the new domino Rotation.
        Parameters:
        domino - Domino that must rotate.
        See Also:
        Rotation

      • discardDomino

        public Response discardDomino()
        Discards the Domino that the current Player has to place.
        Returns:
        Response.NEXTTURNPLAYER if it must be the turn of the next Player. Response.PICKDOMINOES if a new turn must be started. A new line of Dominos must be picked. Response.NULL if nothing must be done. It's probably a bug.

      • playerChoosesPositionForDomino

        public Response playerChoosesPositionForDomino(Position position1,
                                               Position position2)
                                        throws InvalidDominoPosition
        Determines the Position chosen by the current Player for his Domino.
        Parameters:
        position1 - Position for the first LandPortion of the Domino. Take care, position1 must have an x lower than or equal to that of position2. Also, position1 must have an y greater than or equal to that of position2.
        position2 - Position for the second LandPortion of the Domino.
        Returns:
        Response.NEXTTURNPLAYER if it must be the turn of the next Player. Response.PICKDOMINOES if a new turn must be started. A new line of Dominos must be picked.
        Throws:
        InvalidDominoPosition
        See Also:
        LandPortion

      • calculateScore

        public java.util.Map<Player,java.lang.Integer> calculateScore()
        Calculates the score of the Game.
        Returns:
        Map containing all Players and their associated score.

      • getWinners

        public java.util.List<Player> getWinners()
        Calculates the winner of the Game.
        Returns:
        List containing one or many winners.

      • getDominoes

        public DominoesList getDominoes()

        Returns:
        DominoesList containing all Dominos in the Game stack.

      • setDominoes

        public void setDominoes(DominoesList dominoes)
        Sets all the Dominos stored in the Game stack. Take care, it replaces all previous Dominos stored in this stack.
        Parameters:
        dominoes - DominoesList to be set as the Game stack.

      • addDomino

        public void addDomino(Domino domino)
        Adds a Domino in the Game stack.
        Parameters:
        domino - Domino to be added into the Game stack.

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
        Returns all Players of the Game.
        Returns:
        List of all Players in the Game.

      • setPlayers

        public void setPlayers(java.util.List<Player> players)
        Sets all Players in the Game. Take care, it replaces all previous Players set in the Game.
        Parameters:
        players - List of Players of the Game to be set.

      • getPlayerTurns

        public java.util.List<java.util.Map<Player,java.lang.Integer>> getPlayerTurns()
        Returns the List> of Players turns. It contains the order of player turns, for each one.
        Returns:
        List> of the Players turns.

      • setPlayerTurns

        public void setPlayerTurns(java.util.List<java.util.Map<Player,java.lang.Integer>> playerTurns)
        Sets the List> of Players turns. It contains the order of player turns, for each one. Take care, it replaces the previous List stored.
        Parameters:
        playerTurns - List> of the Players turns to be set.

      • getTurnNumber

        Returns the current turn number.
        Returns:
        The current turn number.

      • setTurnNumber

        Sets the current turn number.
        Parameters:
        turnNumber - Current turn number to be srt.

      • getPickedDominoes

        public java.util.List<DominoesList> getPickedDominoes()
        Returns a List of DominoesList of pickedDominoes. At each execution of pickDominoes() a new DominoesList is added.
        Returns:
        List of DominoesList of pickedDominoes.
        See Also:
        pickDominoes()

      • setPickedDominoes

        public void setPickedDominoes(java.util.List<DominoesList> pickedDominoes)
        Sets the List of DominoesList of pickedDominoes.
        Parameters:
        pickedDominoes - List of DominoesList of pickedDominoes to be set.
        See Also:
        pickDominoes()

      • getPreviousDomino

        public Domino getPreviousDomino()
        Returns the previous Domino of the current Player. It's generally the Domino that the current Player has to place on his Board.
        Returns:
        Previous Domino of the current Player.

      • setPreviousDomino

        public void setPreviousDomino(Domino previousDomino)
        Sets the previous Domino of the current Player. It's generally the Domino that the current Player has to place on his Board.
        Parameters:
        previousDomino - Previous Domino of the current Player to be set.

      • getNewDomino

        public Domino getNewDomino()
        Returns the new Domino of the current Player. It's generally the Domino on which the current Player has placed one of his King.
        Returns:
        New Domino of the current Player.

      • setNewDomino

        public void setNewDomino(Domino newDomino)
        Sets the new Domino of the current Player. It's generally the Domino on which the current Player has placed one of his King.
        Parameters:
        newDomino - New Domino of the current Player to be set.

      • isLastTurn

        public boolean isLastTurn()
        Returns if this is the last turn of the Game.
        Returns:
        true if this is the last turn of the Game. false otherwise.

      • setLastTurn

        public void setLastTurn(boolean lastTurn)
        Sets if this is the last turn of the Game.
        Parameters:
        lastTurn - Boolean defining if this is the last Game turn.
